alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford; Orange; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:38PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Alamance, southwestern Orange, northeastern Randolph, southeastern Guilford and northwestern Chatham Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elon to 13 miles south of Burlington to 7 miles east of Randleman. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Asheboro, Graham, Siler City, Liberty, Ramseur, Franklinville, Swepsonville, Alamance and Staley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
